event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: No repair action is recommended at this time.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: The number of errors associated with this memory page has exceeded acceptable levels.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item: This message indicates that the Solaris Fault Manager has received reports that correctable memory errors attributed to a single page of physical memory have been detected. Ongoing diagnosis applied to the error reports has determined that a page is faulty. No repair action is required or recommended at this time. No data has been lost. If and when the Solaris Fault Manager determines that there is sufficient cause, service action will be recommended at that time.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: Removing a single page from service (where supported) has a negligible impact on performance.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: If Solaris is running on bare-metal (native boot) an attempt will be made to remove this memory page from service.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Memory module errors exceeding acceptable levels
